title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Northridge, LA

content.rendered:
Called a “jewel of the San Fernando Valley,” Northridge is a neighborhood in the city of Los Angeles. It’s an area with its own unique personality where anyone can feel at home and live a fulfilling life. If you’re thinking of making the big move, use this neighborhood guide to navigate your way through the area — from the average rent in Northridge and the public transport options, to the best restaurants and where to find rooms for rent in Northridge.

Related: 15 Things To Do In Northridge, LA

Where is Northridge, LA?

Northridge is located near the northwest edge of the San Fernando Valley between Chatsworth, Porter Ranch, the Granada Hills, and Reseda. You can find the California State University, Northridge in the area, and even a historic Los Angeles roller skating rink, Northridge Skateland.

The area was actually named North Los Angeles in the early 20th century, before it became Northridge in the 1930s due to the confusion with its surrounding neighborhoods. If you’re looking to move to Los Angeles, read on to know where to find rooms for rent in Northridge, LA.

Finding Rooms for Rent in Northridge, LA

Find Rooms For Rent In Northridge, LA

The community of Northridge is highly diverse. There are lots of coffee shops, boutiques, and recreational centers for you to explore while finding out the average rent in Northridge, CA.

Average Rent in Northridge, LA

An area that was once filled with dome-shaped houses settled by the native Gabrielino or Tongva people, Northridge is now an urban neighborhood with a diverse and loving community that will make you feel right at home.

Is Northridge safe?

Northridge is counted as one of the safest areas in Los Angeles County, with a lower-than-average crime rate of 26%. Nonetheless, it’s important to remember the following numbers in case you encounter anything suspicious around the area.

  • Call 911 for any life-threatening emergency that requires immediate response from the police, fire, or ambulance services.
  • Call 877-275-5273 (877-ASK-LAPD) for non-emergencies that require a response from the Los Angeles Police Department.

You can also download these personal safety apps to ensure the safety of yourself and those around you, especially if you’re finding rooms for rent in Northridge. They’re all free and can be used by anyone.

  • Nixle
  • OnWatch
  • bSafe
  • First Aid

Public Transit in Northridge

Walkability

Northridge is the 78th most walkable neighborhood in Los Angeles, with a walk score of 49 and a bike score of 57. Although running errands around the neighborhood is convenient with a car, biking around and using public transport is a good way to explore the area, check out restaurants and find rooms for rent in Northridge.

Roads & Traffic

The roads of Northridge are pretty wide, with lots of side streets you can use as shortcuts. Use this handy website to give you an overview of the live traffic in the neighborhood before you leave home.

Nearby Train Stations

Northridge station is served by the Metrolink Ventura County Line that can take you from Union Station in Downtown Los Angeles to East Ventura station in Ventura. Check out their website to find out more about where the train line can take you.

Nearby Bus Stops

The area has about eight bus lines passing through and many bus stops scattered around. The 240 Metro Local Line can take you all the way to Universal City, while the Metro G Line (Orange) passes through Reseda station to take you to Chatsworth or North Hollywood. Use this website to look at the metro schedules so you can catch a bus to your favorite restaurant in Northridge.

Restaurants in Northridge

1. Lum-Ka-Naad

For extraordinary Thai food, Lum-Ka-Naad is the best in the neighborhood. They have a big menu, but we recommended you go for the dishes in the menu’s “Northern” and “Southern” categories, as these are meals from the owner’s home regions. Remember, Thais take their spice seriously, so order with caution!

Menu

2. Brent’s Deli

Brent’s Deli is known as a staple and one of the go-to restaurants in Northridge. With a 650-item menu, this family-owned deli is always full — a sure sign of how good the food is! Make sure to order their best-selling Black Pastrami Reuben, and don’t forget to doggy bag your leftovers!

Menu
Order Online

3. Szechuan Place

A community favorite, Szechuan Place brings quality American Chinese food to Northridge. It’s an infamous restaurant with an extensive menu where you can order classics like beef chow mein and General Tso’s chicken. And while you’re there, you’ve gotta try the mapo tofu!

Visit the Website

Parks in Northridge

  • Vanalden Park is a small park along Vanalden Ave. It has a horseshoe pit, a jogging path, and picnic tables, so you can take a walk and enjoy the fresh air in this pocket park.
  • Dearborn Park is a public park with lots of open space and convenient facilities perfect for a fun day out. There are basketball and tennis courts, a playground for children, and even picnic tables. Why not bring a mat and lay down on the grass and catch some rays? Or grab takeout from one of the best restaurants in Northridge and eat out here in the park. You’ll love it!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Westwood Los Angeles

Is Northridge student-friendly?

Northridge is home to California State University, Northridge (CSUN), and many public and private schools. There are 11 public and nine private primary and secondary schools in the neighborhood. CSUN is part of the California State University system that offers numerous bachelor’s and master’s degrees in a wide range of different disciplines.

The city itself is definitely student-friendly! If you’re looking for a room to rent, you’ll find plenty in Northridge, as well as loads of affordable, delicious restaurants, beautiful parks and so much more.

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Northridge? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
